definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
Pope Benedict XVI/Joseph Alois Ratzinger (1927-), pope 2005-2013

sentences.english: The Lord appeared to Abraham by the terebinths of Mamre.
sentences.chinese: 天主在幔利的篤薅香樹旁顯現在亞伯拉罕面前。

sentences.english: Yuan Hong, "In the history of transmission of the hing, so pass ancient and modern and Benedict Norm."
sentences.chinese: 袁宏提出，“史傳之興，所以通古今而篤名教”。

sentences.english: This is Benedict's first trip to France as pontiff.
sentences.chinese: 這是本篤十六世第一次以教皇的身份訪問法國。

sentences.english: In the mid 20th century the Trappists increased in membership, particularly in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在20世紀中葉的熙篤增加成員，特別是在美國。

sentences.english: Recently, the focus has switched to Benedict’s own record.
sentences.chinese: 最近，焦點轉向了本篤十六世自己的記錄。

sentences.english: The woodpecker kills the insects in the trees stomach.
sentences.chinese: 啄木鳥“篤篤篤”幾下就把大樹肚皮裏的蟲吃了。

sentences.english: In 719, Otmar, an Alemannic priest, built St Gallen abbey, which developed into one of the largest St Benedictine abbeys in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 這所修道院後來發展成歐洲最大的聖本篤修道院之一。

definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
pool/pond/(of metals etc) luster/favor or beneficence/damp/moist
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
paraphernalia of a guard of honor
to perform one's job/attendant/job/duties/(respectful appellation for the addressee) you/your Excellency/(Church) deacon
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
